post.summary: Upload an audio or video file which can be transcribed.
post.description: Upload your audio or video file directly to the AssemblyAI API if it isn't accessible via a URL already.

post.summary: Create a transcript from an audio file
post.description: Create a transcript from an audio or video file that is accessible via a URL.

201.description: Transcript created and queued for processing.

get.description: Retrieve a list of transcripts you have created.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum amount of transcripts to retrieve

parameters.name: created_on
parameters.description: Only get transcripts created on this date

parameters.name: before_id
parameters.description: Get transcripts that were created before this transcript ID

parameters.name: after_id
parameters.description: Get transcripts that were created after this transcript ID

parameters.name: throttled_only
parameters.description: Only get throttled transcripts, overrides the status filter

200.description: A list of transcripts filtered by `limit` and `status`

get.description: Get the transcript resource. The transcript is ready when the "status" is "completed".

get.summary: Export transcript as SRT or VTT captions.
get.description: Export your transcript in SRT or VTT format, to be plugged into a video player for subtitles and closed captions.

parameters.name: chars_per_caption
parameters.description: The maximum number of characters per caption

schema.example:
WEBVTT
00:12.340 --> 00:16.220
Last year I showed these two slides said that demonstrate
00:16.200 --> 00:20.040
that the Arctic ice cap which for most of the last 3,000,000 years has been the
00:20.020 --> 00:25.040
size of the lower 48 States has shrunk by 40% but this understates

get.summary: Get the transcript split by sentences
get.description: Get the transcript split by sentences. The API will attempt to semantically segment the transcript into sentences to create more reader-friendly transcripts.

get.summary: Get the transcript split by paragraphs
get.description: Get the transcript split by paragraphs. The API will attempt to semantically segment your transcript into paragraphs to create more reader-friendly transcripts.

get.summary: Search the given transcript for words, numbers, or phrases
get.description: Search through the transcript for a specific set of keywords. You can search for individual words, numbers, or phrases containing up to five words or numbers.

get.summary: Retrieves the redacted audio object containing the status and URL to the redacted audio.
get.description: Retrieves the redacted audio object containing the status and URL to the redacted audio.

200.description: The redacted audio object containing the status and URL to the redacted audio.

post.summary: Create a temporary authentication token for real-time transcription
post.description: Create a temporary authentication token for real-time transcription

requestBody.description: Parameters to create a temporary authentication token.

post.summary: Generate a custom summary from one or more transcripts.
post.description: Custom Summary allows you to distill a piece of audio into a few impactful sentences. You can give the model context to obtain more targeted results while outputting the results in a variety of formats described in human language.

post.summary: Create answers to one or more questions about one or more transcripts.
post.description: Question & Answer allows you to ask free-form questions about a single transcript or a group of transcripts. The questions can be any whose answers you find useful, such as judging whether a caller is likely to become a customer or whether all items on a meeting's agenda were covered.

requestBody.description: Parameters to ask questions about the transcripts.

post.summary: Extract action items from one or more meeting transcripts.
post.description: Use LeMUR to generate a list of Action Items from a transcript

requestBody.description: Parameters to generate action items from transcripts.

post.summary: Ask LeMUR to use one or more transcripts with a Custom Task to handle your specialized task.
post.description: Use LeMUR to ask anything with Custom Task

requestBody.description: Parameters to run the custom task.

delete.summary: Delete the data for a previously submitted LeMUR request.
delete.description:
Delete the data for a previously submitted LeMUR request.
The LLM response data, as well as any context provided in the original request will be removed.

parameters.name: request_id
parameters.description: The ID of the LeMUR request whose data you want to delete. This would be found in the response of the original request.

status.description: The status of the redacted audio

redacted_audio_url.description: The URL of the redacted audio file

RedactedAudioStatus.description: The status of the redacted audio

total_count.description: The total count of all matched instances. For e.g., word 1 matched 2 times, and word 2 matched 3 times, `total_count` will equal 5.

count.description: The total amount of times the word is in the transcript

indexes.description: An array of all index locations for that word within the `words` array of the completed transcript

WordSearchTimestamp.description: An array of timestamps structured as [`start_time`, `end_time`] in milliseconds

Timestamp.description: Timestamp containing a start and end property in milliseconds.

CreateTranscriptOptionalParameters.description: The parameters for creating a transcript

language_code.description:
The language of your audio file. Possible values are found in [Supported Languages](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Concepts/supported_languages).
The default value is 'en_us'.

punctuate.description: Enable Automatic Punctuation, can be true or false.

format_text.description: Enable Text Formatting, can be true or false.

dual_channel.description: Enable [Dual Channel](https://assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speech_recognition#dual-channel-transcription) transcription, can be true or false.

webhook_url.description: The URL to which we send webhooks upon trancription completion, if provided in the transcription request.

webhook_auth_header_name.description: The header name which should be sent back with webhook calls, if provided in the transcription request.

webhook_auth_header_value.description: Defaults to null. Optionally allows a user to specify a header name and value to send back with a webhook call for added security.

auto_highlights.description: Whether Key Phrases was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

audio_start_from.description: The point in time, in milliseconds, to begin transcription from in your media file

audio_end_at.description: The point in time, in milliseconds, to stop transcribing in your media file

word_boost.description: The list of custom vocabulary to boost transcription probability for, if provided in the transcription request.

boost_param.description: The word boost parameter value, if provided in the transcription request.

filter_profanity.description: Filter profanity from the transcribed text, can be true or false.

redact_pii.description: Redact PII from the transcribed text using the Redact PII model, can be true or false

redact_pii_audio.description: Generate a copy of the original media file with spoken PII "beeped" out, can be true or false. See [PII redaction](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/pii_redaction) for more details.

redact_pii_audio_quality.description: Controls the filetype of the audio created by redact_pii_audio. Currently supports mp3 (default) and wav. See [PII redaction](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/pii_redaction) for more details.

redact_pii_policies.description: The list of PII Redaction policies to enable. See [PII redaction](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/pii_redaction) for more details.

redact_pii_sub.description: The replacement logic for detected PII, can be "entity_type" or "hash". See [PII redaction](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/pii_redaction) for more details.

speaker_labels.description: Enable [Speaker diarization](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speaker_diarization), can be true or false

speakers_expected.description: Tells the speaker label model how many speakers it should attempt to identify, up to 10. See [Speaker diarization](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speaker_diarization) for more details.

content_safety.description: Enable [Content Moderation](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/content_moderation), can be true or false

iab_categories.description: Enable [Topic Detection](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/iab_classification), can be true or false

language_detection.description: Whether [Automatic language detection](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speech_recognition#automatic-language-detection) was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false.

custom_spelling.description: Customize how words are spelled and formatted using to and from values

disfluencies.description: Transcribe Filler Words, like "umm", in your media file; can be true or false.

sentiment_analysis.description: Enable [Sentiment Analysis](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/sentiment_analysis), can be true or false

auto_chapters.description: Enable [Auto Chapters](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/auto_chapters), can be true or false

entity_detection.description: Enable [Entity Detection](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/entity_detection), can be true or false

speech_threshold.description:
Reject audio files that contain less than this fraction of speech.
Valid values are in the range [0, 1] inclusive.

summarization.description: Enable [Summarization](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/summarization), can be true or false

summary_model.description: The model to summarize the transcript

custom_topics.description: Whether custom topics was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

topics.description: The list of custom topics provided if custom topics was enabled in the transcription request

CreateTranscriptParameters.description: The parameters for creating a transcript

audio_url.description: The URL of the audio or video file to transcribe.

SummaryModel.description: The model to summarize the transcript

TranscriptBoostParam.description: The word boost parameter value, if provided in the transcription request.

TranscriptCustomSpelling.description: Object containing words or phrases to replace, and the word or phrase to replace with

to.description: Word or phrase to replace with

SubstitutionPolicy.description: The replacement logic for detected PII, can be "entity_type" or "hash". See [PII redaction](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/pii_redaction) for more details.

TranscriptLanguageCode.description:
The language of your audio file. Possible values are found in [Supported Languages](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Concepts/supported_languages).
The default value is 'en_us'.

TranscriptStatus.description: The status of your transcription. Possible values are queued, processing, completed, or error.

queued.description: The audio file is in the queue to be processed by the API.

processing.description: The audio file is being processed by the API.

completed.description: The transcription job has been completed successfully.

error.description: An error occurred while processing the audio file.

id.description: The unique identifier of your transcription

language_model.description: The language model that was used for the transcription

acoustic_model.description: The acoustic model that was used for the transcription

status.description: The status of your transcription. Possible values are queued, processing, completed, or error.

language_code.description:
The language of your audio file.
Possible values are found in [Supported Languages](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Concepts/supported_languages).
The default value is 'en_us'.

audio_url.description: The URL of the media that was transcribed

text.description: The textual transcript of your media file

words.description:
An array of temporally-sequential word objects, one for each word in the transcript.
See [Speech recognition](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speech_recognition) for more information.

utterances.description:
When dual_channel or speaker_labels is enabled, a list of turn-by-turn utterance objects.
See [Speaker diarization](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speaker_diarization) for more information.

confidence.description: The confidence score for the transcript, between 0.0 (low confidence) and 1.0 (high confidence)

audio_duration.description: The duration of this transcript object's media file, in seconds

punctuate.description: Whether Automatic Punctuation was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false.

format_text.description: Whether Text Formatting was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

dual_channel.description: Whether [Dual channel transcription](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speech_recognition#dual-channel-transcription) was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

webhook_url.description: The URL to which we send webhooks upon trancription completion, if provided in the transcription request

webhook_status_code.description: The status code we received from your server when delivering your webhook, if a webhook URL was provided in the transcription request

webhook_auth.description: Whether webhook authentication details were provided in the transcription request

webhook_auth_header_name.description: The header name which should be sent back with webhook calls, if provided in the transcription request

speed_boost.description: Whether speed boost was enabled in the transcription request

auto_highlights.description: Whether Key Phrases was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

auto_highlights_result.description:
An array of results for the Key Phrases model, if it was enabled during the transcription request.
See [Key phrases](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/key_phrases) for more information.

audio_start_from.description: The point in time, in milliseconds, in the file at which the transcription was started, if provided in the transcription request

audio_end_at.description: The point in time, in milliseconds, in the file at which the transcription was terminated, if provided in the transcription request

word_boost.description: The list of custom vocabulary to boost transcription probability for, if provided in the transcription request

boost_param.description: The word boost parameter value, if provided in the transcription request

filter_profanity.description: Whether [Profanity Filtering](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speech_recognition#profanity-filtering) was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

redact_pii.description: Whether [PII Redaction](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/pii_redaction) was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

redact_pii_audio.description:
Whether a redacted version of the audio file was generated (enabled or disabled in the transcription request),
either true or false. See [PII redaction](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/pii_redaction) for more information.

redact_pii_audio_quality.description:
The audio quality of the PII-redacted audio file, if enabled in the transcription request.
See [PII redaction](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/pii_redaction) for more information.

redact_pii_policies.description:
The list of PII Redaction policies that were enabled, if PII Redaction is enabled.
See [PII redaction](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/pii_redaction) for more information.

redact_pii_sub.description: The replacement logic for detected PII, can be "entity_type" or "hash". See [PII redaction](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/pii_redaction) for more details.

speaker_labels.description: Enable [Speaker diarization](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speaker_diarization), can be true or false

speakers_expected.description: Defaults to null. Tells the speaker label model how many speakers it should attempt to identify, up to 10. See [Speaker diarization](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speaker_diarization) for more details.

content_safety.description: Enable [Content Moderation](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/content_moderation), can be true or false

content_safety_labels.description:
An array of results for the Content Moderation model, if it was enabled during the transcription request.
See [Content moderation](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/content_moderation) for more information.

status.description: Will be either success, or unavailable in the rare case that the Content Safety Labels model failed.

iab_categories.description: Enable [Topic Detection](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/iab_classification), can be true or false

iab_categories_result.description:
An array of results for the Topic Detection model, if it was enabled during the transcription request.
See [Topic Detection](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/iab_classification) for more information.

status.description: Will be either success, or unavailable in the rare case that the Content Moderation model failed.

results.description: An array of results for the Topic Detection model.

summary.description: The overall relevance of topic to the entire audio file

language_detection.description: Whether [Automatic language detection](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/speech_recognition#automatic-language-detection) was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

custom_spelling.description: Customize how words are spelled and formatted using to and from values

auto_chapters.description: Enable [Auto Chapters](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/auto_chapters), can be true or false

chapters.description: An array of temporally sequential chapters for the audio file

summarization.description: Whether [Summarization](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/summarization) was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

summary_type.description: The type of summary generated, if [Summarization](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/summarization) was enabled in the transcription request

summary_model.description:
The Summarization model used to generate the summary,
if [Summarization](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/summarization) was enabled in the transcription request

summary.description: The generated summary of the media file, if [Summarization](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/summarization) was enabled in the transcription request

custom_topics.description: Whether custom topics was enabled in the transcription request, either true or false

topics.description: The list of custom topics provided if custom topics was enabled in the transcription request

disfluencies.description: Transcribe Filler Words, like "umm", in your media file; can be true or false

sentiment_analysis.description: Enable [Sentiment Analysis](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/sentiment_analysis), can be true or false

sentiment_analysis_results.description:
An array of results for the Sentiment Analysis model, if it was enabled during the transcription request.
See [Sentiment analysis](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/sentiment_analysis) for more information.

entity_detection.description: Enable [Entity Detection](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/entity_detection), can be true or false

entities.description:
An array of results for the Entity Detection model, if it was enabled during the transcription request.
See [Entity detection](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/entity_detection) for more information.

speech_threshold.description:
Defaults to null. Reject audio files that contain less than this fraction of speech.
Valid values are in the range [0, 1] inclusive.

throttled.description: True while a request is throttled and false when a request is no longer throttled

error.description: Error message of why the transcript failed

gist.description: An ultra-short summary (just a few words) of the content spoken in the chapter

headline.description: A single sentence summary of the content spoken during the chapter

summary.description: A one paragraph summary of the content spoken during the chapter

start.description: The starting time, in milliseconds, for the chapter

end.description: The starting time, in milliseconds, for the chapter

entity_type.description: The type of entity for the detected entity

text.description: The text for the detected entity

start.description: The starting time, in milliseconds, at which the detected entity appears in the audio file

end.description: The ending time, in milliseconds, for the detected entity in the audio file

EntityType.description: The type of entity for the detected entity

banking_information.description: Banking information, including account and routing numbers

credit_card_expiration.description: Expiration date of a credit card

date_of_birth.description: Date of Birth (e.g., Date of Birth: March 7, 1961)

drug.description: Medications, vitamins, or supplements (e.g., Advil, Acetaminophen, Panadol)

event.description: Name of an event or holiday (e.g., Olympics, Yom Kippur)

injury.description: Bodily injury (e.g., I broke my arm, I have a sprained wrist)

language.description: Name of a natural language (e.g., Spanish, French)

location.description: Any location reference including mailing address, postal code, city, state, province, or country

medical_condition.description: Name of a medical condition, disease, syndrome, deficit, or disorder (e.g., chronic fatigue syndrome, arrhythmia, depression)

medical_process.description: Medical process, including treatments, procedures, and tests (e.g., heart surgery, CT scan)

money_amount.description: Name and/or amount of currency (e.g., 15 pesos, $94.50)

nationality.description: Terms indicating nationality, ethnicity, or race (e.g., American, Asian, Caucasian)

occupation.description: Job title or profession (e.g., professor, actors, engineer, CPA)

organization.description: Name of an organization (e.g., CNN, McDonalds, University of Alaska)

password.description: Account passwords, PINs, access keys, or verification answers (e.g., 27%alfalfa, temp1234, My mother's maiden name is Smith)

person_name.description: Name of a person (e.g., Bob, Doug Jones)

political_affiliation.description: Terms referring to a political party, movement, or ideology (e.g., Republican, Liberal)

religion.description: Terms indicating religious affiliation (e.g., Hindu, Catholic)

SentimentAnalysisResult.description: The result of the sentiment analysis model.

start.description: The starting time, in milliseconds, of the sentence

end.description: The ending time, in milliseconds, of the sentence

sentiment.description: The detected sentiment for the sentence, one of POSITIVE, NEUTRAL, NEGATIVE

confidence.description: The confidence score for the detected sentiment of the sentence, from 0 to 1

speaker.description: The speaker of the sentence if Speaker Diarization is enabled, else null

TopicDetectionResult.description: THe result of the topic detection model.

text.description: The text in the transcript in which a detected topic occurs

relevance.description: How relevant the detected topic is of a detected topic

label.description: The IAB taxonomical label for the label of the detected topic, where > denotes supertopic/subtopic relationship
The label of the sensitive topic

confidence.description: The confidence score for the topic being discussed, from 0 to 1

severity.description: How severely the topic is discussed in the section, from 0 to 1

text.description: The transcript of the section flagged by the Content Moderation model

labels.description: An array of objects, one per sensitive topic that was detected in the section

sentences_idx_start.description: The sentence index at which the section begins

sentences_idx_end.description: The sentence index at which the section ends

summary.description: A summary of the Content Moderation confidence results for the entire audio file

additionalProperties.description: A confidence score for the presence of the sensitive topic "topic" across the entire audio file

severity_score_summary.description: A summary of the Content Moderation severity results for the entire audio file

AutoHighlightsResult.description:
An array of results for the Key Phrases model, if it was enabled during the transcription request.
See [Key phrases](https://www.assemblyai.com/docs/Models/key_phrases) for more information.

results.description: A temporally-sequential array of Key Phrases

count.description: The total number of times the key phrase appears in the audio file

rank.description: The total relevancy to the overall audio file of this key phrase - a greater number means more relevant

text.description: The text itself of the key phrase

timestamps.description: The timestamp of the of the key phrase

limit.description: Maximum amount of transcripts to retrieve

created_on.description: Only get transcripts created on this date

before_id.description: Get transcripts that were created before this transcript ID

after_id.description: Get transcripts that were created after this transcript ID

throttled_only.description: Only get throttled transcripts, overrides the status filter

upload_url.description: A URL that points to your audio file, accessible only by AssemblyAI's servers

expires_in.description: The amount of time until the token expires in seconds.

token.description: The temporary authentication token for real-time transcription

AudioIntelligenceModelStatus.description: Will be either success, or unavailable in the rare case that the model failed.

request_id.description: The ID of the LeMUR request

request_id_to_purge.description: The ID of the deletion request of the LeMUR request

deleted.description: Whether the request data was deleted.

request_id.description: The ID of the LeMUR request

response.description: The answers generated by LeMUR and their questions.

LemurQuestionAnswer.description: An answer generated by LeMUR and its question.

question.description: The question for LeMUR to answer.

transcript_ids.description: A list of completed transcripts with text. Up to 100 files max, or 100 hours max. Whichever is lower.

context.description: Context to provide the model. This can be a string or a free-form JSON value.

max_output_size.description: Max output size in tokens. Up to 4000 allowed.

temperature.description:
The temperature to use for the model.
Higher values result in answers that are more creative, lower values are more conservative.
Can be any value between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.

answer_format.description: How you want the summary to be returned. This can be any text. Examples: "TLDR", "bullet points"

questions.description: A list of questions to ask.

question.description: The question you wish to ask. For more complex questions use default model.

context.description: Any context about the transcripts you wish to provide. This can be a string, or free-form JSON.

answer_format.description: How you want the answer to be returned. This can be any text. Can't be used with answer_options. Examples: "short sentence", "bullet points"

answer_options.description: What discrete options to return. Useful for precise responses. Can't be used with answer_format. Example: ["Yes", "No"]

prompt.description: Your text to prompt the model to produce a desired output, including any context you want to pass into the model.

LemurModel.description: The model that is used for the final prompt after compression is performed (options: "basic" and "default").

InternalServerError.description: An error occurred while processing the request
